title: Activated Cadmium
summary:
Activated Cadmium (Cd+) is a red stars).

These planets are often extreme weather worlds.
game_description:
A chromatic metal, generated by fusion in the heart of a star.

This Cadmium has been activated by the extreme conditions in which it was formed, and is highly valuable.

Cadmium is found on planets orbiting red stars, and can be placed in a Refiner to create purified Chromatic Metal.
source_info: It can be found on planets orbiting red stars, (typically extreme weather planets) where it can be mined with the Terrain Manipulator attachment for the Multi-tool.
release_history:
* NEXT - added as a resource, using the Rubeum icon
* Waypoint - Value changed, previously was 450.0
additional_info: The in-game abbreviation for this resource is Cd. For wiki convention, a + has been added to the abbreviation for all "activated" resources.

title: Activated Copper
summary: Activated Copper (Cu+) is a resource.
game_description:
A chromatic metal, generated by fusion in the heart of a star.

This Copper has been activated by the extreme conditions in which it was formed, and is highly valuable.

Copper is found on planets orbiting yellow stars, and can be placed in a Refiner to create purified Chromatic Metal.
source_info:
It can be found on planets orbiting yellow stars, (typically extreme weather planets) where it can be mined with the Terrain Manipulator attachment for the Multi-tool.

It can also be salvaged from starships at a Starship Outfitting Terminal.
release_history:
* NEXT - Added as a resource.
* Waypoint - Value changed, previously was 245.0.
additional_info:
* The in-game abbreviation for this resource is Cu. For wiki convention, a + has been added to the abbreviation for all "activated" resources.
* Used to repair Corroded Tanks in recovered starships.

title: Activated Emeril
summary: Activated Emeril (Em+) is a resource that can be found on extreme weather planets.
game_description:
A chromatic metal, generated by fusion in the heart of a star.

This green stars, and can be placed in a Refiner to create purified Chromatic Metal.
source_info:
* Mined from large deposits using the Terrain Manipulator. These deposits can be found using the Multi-tool.
* Can be provided by Frigate expeditions.
release_history:
* NEXT - this item was added as a resource
* Waypoint - Value changed, previously was 696.0
additional_info: The in-game abbreviation for this resource is Em. For wiki convention, a + has been added to the abbreviation for all "activated" resources.

title: Activated Indium
summary: Activated Indium (In+) is a resource.
game_description:
A chromatic metal, generated by fusion in the heart of a star.

Indium is found on planets orbiting blue stars, and can be placed in a Refiner to create purified Chromatic Metal.

This Indium has been activated by the extreme conditions in which it was formed, and is highly valuable.
source_info:
* It can be found on planets orbiting blue stars (typically extreme weather planets). It's easy to spot because of its specific blue color.
* Can be returned by industrial Frigate expeditions.
release_history:
*NEXT - added as a resource, using the Cymatygen icon
*Waypoint - Value changed, previously was 949.0
additional_info: The in-game abbreviation for this resource is In. For wiki convention, a + has been added to the abbreviation for all "activated" resources.

title: Activated Quartzite
summary: Activated Quartzite (Qu+) is a resource.
game_description:
A chromatic metal, generated by fusion in the heart of a star.

Quartzite is found on planets orbiting purple stars, and can be placed in a Refiner to create purified Chromatic Metal.

This Quartzite has been activated by the extreme conditions in which it was formed, and is highly valuable.
source_info: It can be found on planets orbiting purple stars, (typically extreme weather planets) where it can be mined with the Terrain Manipulator attachment for the Multi-tool. It's easy to spot because of its specific purple color.
release_history: *Worlds Part II - Added as a resource.

title: Ammonia
summary: Ammonia (NH3) is a localised earth elements.
game_description: Local mineral extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from common materials after inspection with an toxic environment.
source_info:
* As a secondary element in some minerals or Hotspots on planets with Toxic biomes.
*Found in Hotspots on Mega Exotic planets located in green stellar systems.
* Also available from some
release_history:
* NEXT - Added as a resource.
* Visions - Hidden changes: The information panel has an additional icon indicating its purpose.

title: Ancestral Memories
summary: Ancestral Memories is a resource and one of the special elements.
game_description:
The echo of a genetic possibility, forgotten by evolution. It twitches with a wild energy.

Extracted from a creature caught within a repeating circuit of time. Of great value to Specialist Polo as they research the loop.
source_info: Can be extracted from any creature fed with Creature Pellets in Expedition 7: Leviathan.
release_history: * Expedition 7: Leviathan - Introduced as a resource.

title: Atlantideum
summary: Atlantideum (∞) is a resource and one of the special elements.
game_description:
This ethereal substance spills from the bodies of corrupted Sentinels as they fall, a shower of prismatic grains seeking out their next host. It evades all attempts to contain it, as if it had a will of its own, a strong desire for its own freedom.

It possesses a crystalline beauty that cannot be reconciled with the corruption from whence it flows.
source_info:
Atlantideum can be acquired in a variety of ways:
* Mining purple crystals on drones or quadrupeds (66%)
* Looting wheelbarrows at Harmonic Camps (8%)
release_history:
* Interceptor - Added as a resource.
* Echoes - Can now be used at monoliths to get lore.

title: Atmosphere Harvester
summary: Atmosphere Harvester is a portable gases from a planet's atmosphere. It can extract the planet's gases without the need for constant supervision.
game_description: An automated siphon unit for the collection of valuable gases. Once activated, the harvester condenses and compresses substances from the air over time. Compressed gas is then stored safely until collected.
release_history: * NEXT 1.63 - Fixed an issue that caused the Atmosphere Harvester to collect an invalid substance on specific rare biomes. Fixed an issue that caused it to run out of fuel and empty its collection hopper when the player left the system. (this may not have been fixed, further testing required)
additional_info:
* Its blueprint is rewarded when you construct the Barren planets
** Irradiated and Frozen planets
**Lush and Toxic planets
**Exotic planets
* Although Atmosphere Harvesters must be built on outside terrain, they can clip through base walls if placed close, allowing access to them from inside. This is useful for safely collecting resources on inhospitable planets.

title: Basalt
summary: Basalt (B) is a resource.
game_description:
Local mineral extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from common minerals after inspection with an Analysis Visor.

Typically found on planets with a volcanic environment.
source_info:
* In resource deposits on Volcanic planets, though not all eligible planets will present deposits.
* As a secondary element in some Minerals on Volcanic planets.
release_history:
* Origins - Added as a resource.
* Echoes - Can now be created using a refiner.

title: Bromide Salt
summary: Bromide Salt is a 3rd tier tradeable.
game_description:
A crate of bromide salt.

The result of an extensive distillation and evaporation process, the bromide salt vats feed hungry factories in manufacturing systems.
source_info: Bromide Salt can be purchased from Galactic Trade Terminals in all medium-wealth and high-wealth Mining Economy star systems.
use_info:
Bromide Salt can be sold for a profit in any Manufacturing Economy star system.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a trade commodity.
* NEXT - Stack size in Exosuit general inventory raised from 1 to 5.
* Waypoint - Type changed, formerly "Tradable Minerals".

title: Cactus Flesh
summary: Cactus Flesh (Cc) is a resource and one of the Harvested Agricultural Substance flora elements.
game_description: Succulent, edible cactus flesh from the desert planets, but can be farmed in all environments with the aid of a Hydroponics Tray.
source_info: As described in the Game description, this element can be recovered from specific Echinocactus plants in desert/barren Farmer, Cactus Flesh can also be grown as a product of the Echinocactus plant, with a harvest time of 16 hours and a yield of 100.
release_history:
*Foundation - Added as a resource.
*Atlas Rises - Renamed from Spadonium (Sp) to Cactus Flesh. Value changed, previously it was worth 178.8
additional_info:
*The "Cc" symbol for this material is probably short for "Cucrassula," the name for the edible substance which comes from this plant, baked and eaten by Gek (and possibly other races).
* In Latin, the original name of this element means eunuch or castrated.

title: Cadmium
summary: Cadmium (Cd) is a red stars).
game_description:
A chromatic metal, generated by fusion in the heart of a star. Such stellar material ends up forming deposits in the crust of local planets.

Cadmium is found on planets orbiting red stars, and can be placed in a Refiner to create purified Chromatic Metal for use in the manufacture of advanced technologies.
source_info:
* It can be found on planets orbiting red stars, where it can be mined with the Terrain Manipulator attachment for the Multi-tool.
* Dismantling Pulse Engine Upgrade modules.
* Dismantling any class of Photon Cannon Upgrade yields 125 cadmium.
* Dismantling any class of Positron Ejector Upgrade yields 125 cadmium. 
* Dismantling select ship upgrades can yield different amounts of cadmium.
release_history:
* NEXT - Added as a resource.
* Synthesis - Duplication exploit removed: Refining x1 Cadmium + x1 Chromatic Metal yields x2 Cadmium, reduced from x4.
* Waypoint - Value changed, previously was 234.0.
additional_info: * Cadmium (from latin cadmia or from the Greek character Cadmus, ruler of Thebes) is a slightly blueish-white soft metal, however Cadmium deposits in the game may be Otavite or Greenockite, which are cadmium-ores that can be red in colour. Cadmium is commonly used in batteries, electroplating, pigments, and nuclear fission.

infobox.desc: A chromatic metal, generated by fusion in the heart of a star

title: Cadmium Drive
summary: Cadmium Drive is a red coloured star systems.
game_description:
Upgrades the hyperdrive's core bounding magnets, preventing rapid disassembly when attempting to reach rare-class red stellar bodies.

User is advised to access Hyperdrive systems via the Galactic Map.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from Iteration: Hyperion on Space Anomaly for 80
release_history:
* NEXT - Added as a technology.
* Visions - Icon changed.
* Beyond - Blueprint changed, Technology Module was renamed to Wiring Loom.
additional_info:
* Operates automatically when installed and needs no fuel or recharging.
* Gives a bonus to hyperdrive range if the upgrade module is installed adjacent to the ship's hyperdrive or other drive modules.

title: Carbon
summary: Carbon (C) is a resource used in recharging and one of the fuel elements for refining.
game_description:
The building block of all organic life. Of critical importance to space travellers, as Carbon is used to recharge mining equipment.

The Mining Laser will harvest Carbon from trees, plants, and all other forms of vegetable.
source_info:
thumb|Carbon mining in action (Atlas Rises)
* Can be mined from flora.
* It can be found as a secondary element in some minerals.
* It can be farmed by constructing a Standing Planter in a base.
release_history:
*Release - Added as a resource.
*Pathfinder - It can no longer be used to recharge exosuit life support.
*Atlas Rises - Value changed, previously it was worth 6.9

title: Carbon Nanotubes
summary: Carbon Nanotubes is a component that is used for crafting.
game_description:
Metres and metres of high capacity carbon nanotubes.

Their high tensile strength and mild conductivity make these a key component in many advanced technologies.
source_info: Available from some
release_history:
*NEXT - Added as a product. It has the same icon as Damaged Electrode.
*Aquarius - Added fishing bait bonuses.

title: Chlorine
summary: Chlorine (Cl) is a resource and one of the earth elements.
game_description:
A reactive element most easily harvested by processing the salt-infused minerals found in oceans.

Used in the manufacture of advanced technologies.
source_info:
thumb|Chlorine found in the wild as "Organic Rock"
* Created via further refining (detailed below)
* Labeled as 'Organic' Rock when using your Analysis Visor
* Found in large underwater Mineral formations that require an Advanced Mining Laser to harvest.
* From some
release_history:
* NEXT - Added as a resource.
* Visions - Hidden changes: The information panel has an additional icon indicating its purpose.
* Waypoint - Value changed, previously was 602.0
additional_info: * This resource is used to repair Rusted Circuits on ships you find on planets.

title: Chromatic Metal
summary: Chromatic Metal (Ch) is a resource and one of the special elements. It is used for construction of advanced technologies.
game_description:
A processed metal alloy, created in a Refiner from the stellar metals: Copper, Cadmium, Emeril and Indium.

The rarer the stellar metal, the more Chromatic Metal it will produce.

This valuable metal is used in the creation of many advanced technologies.
source_info: [[File:No Man's Sky_20200507201604.png|thumb|Chromatic Metal for purchase from a
release_history:
*NEXT - Added as a resource.
*Visions - Hidden changes: The information panel has an additional icon indicating its purpose.
*Beyond - Hidden changes: Charging removed from the "Used for" list.
*Synthesis - Stellar metal recipes changed, infinite metal exploit fixed.
*Waypoint - Value changed, previously was 245.0, added as a secondary element in some minerals.
*Aquarius - Added fishing bait bonuses.
*WorldsTwo - Added refining recipes to turn Quartzite and Activated Quartzite into Chromatic Metal.
additional_info: In (at least) Aquarius update, refining Cadmium is no longer a 1:1 but 2:1 process, therefore the same as Copper. This might be a bug (Tested with GOG_5.12_Aquarius_129192)

title: Cobalt
summary: Cobalt (Co) is a resource and one of the earth elements.
game_description:
Mined from underground minerals, cobalt is found in plentiful supply in Ion Batteries.

It is used in the creation of several technologies and structures, and can be processed in a Refiner to make the most of its inherent charge.
source_info: * From any
release_history:
* NEXT - Added as a resource.
* Visions - Hidden changes: The information panel has an additional icon indicating its purpose.
* Waypoint - Value changed. previously was 198.0.

title: Compressed Indium Scraps
summary: Compressed Indium Scraps is a tradeable item useful only for scrap.
game_description: A valuable piece of broken down Trade Terminal.
source_info: Sometimes created by a Starship Outfitting Terminal at a Space Station when the player chooses "Claim Scrap" menu option to salvage their starship into Units.
use_info:
Component is useful only as scrap to be sold at a Trade Terminal.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
release_history:
* Synthesis - added as a tradeable.
* Waypoint - Icon changed, previously had the same icon as Ion Capacitor.
additional_info:
* 0-2 piece is awarded when salvaging a starship.
* Maximum stack size is 50.
* The icon is also used by Ohmic Gel.

title: Condensed Carbon
summary: Condensed Carbon (C+) is a resource and one of the fuel elements.
game_description:
Advanced material, processed from regular carbon in a Refiner.

The increased molecule density offers a substantially improved energy-per-gram ratio.

Occasionally found in crystalline form. Harvesting large crystals may require an Advanced Mining Laser.
source_info:
* In crystal minerals located on nearly every planet. The larger minerals require an Advanced Mining Laser. These are visible on the Scanner.
* As a secondary element in some plants.
release_history:
*NEXT - Added as a resource.
*Visions - Hidden changes: The information panel has an additional icon indicating its purpose.
*Waypoint - Added as a secondary element in some plants.
*Aquarius - Added fishing bait bonuses.
additional_info: * If a Traveller NPC asks for Plutonium, the option is to give a "plutonium substitute", generally condensed carbon.

title: Copper
summary: Copper (Cu) is a resource.
game_description:
A chromatic metal, generated by fusion in the heart of a star. Such stellar material ends up forming deposits in the crust of local planets.

Copper is found on planets orbiting yellow stars, and can be placed in a Refiner to create purified Chromatic Metal for use in the manufacture of advanced technologies.
source_info:
Copper sources include:

* yellow stars.
* Galactic Trade Terminals.
* Secondary element in cave minerals (rare).
release_history:
* Release - One of the original elements.
* NEXT - Must now be mined with a Terrain Manipulator; can also be refined to create Chromatic Metal.
* Synthesis - Exploit removed for creating unlimited copper via Refining.
* ExoMech - Added use as an ingredient for Exocraft Hazard Protection upgrades.
* Waypoint - Value changed, previously was 121.0.
additional_info:
* Copper can be sold in the Marketplace.
* The Korvax may ask for 10 of this in exchange for a word of their language.

title: Cryo-Pump
summary: Cryo-Pump is a tradeable.
game_description:
An advanced, self-regulating hybrid material, the Cryo-Pump distributes heat across itself with near perfect efficiency, making it vital in the creation of thermal regulators.

Crafted from Hot Ice and Thermic Condensate
source_info: *Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a trade commodity.
* Beyond - Selling price changed to 1.6 M

title: Crystal Fragment
summary: Crystal Fragment is a curiosity and if analysed, the player will receive a variable amount (22) of Di-hydrogen. There is a small chance to receive a Storm Crystal from it.
game_description:
A crystalline shard with an unusually dense structure. Potentially highly valuable.

Select in the inventory (
source_info: It can be acquired from Di-hydrogen Crystals, indicated with 30px when the Scanner is used.
release_history: * Beyond 2.09.1 - Fixed an issue that caused tips about the Crystal Fragments to appear for players who had no Crystal Fragments.

title: Crystal Sulphide
summary: Crystal Sulphide is a tradeable that is used for crafting.
game_description:
Formed in the incredible, high-pressure furnace of planetary cores, these rich mineral deposits have an almost glass-like quality.

Has a wide variety of industrial uses, taking advantage of both its mineral content and its extreme strength under pressure.
source_info:
thumb|Crystal Sulphide in the wild
Can be obtained from the sides of underwater vents. Use caution when harvesting, as the vent may trigger a blast of super-heated water which may cause damage to the harvester.
release_history: * Abyss 1.71 - Icon changed.

title: Crystallised Helium
summary: Crystallised Helium (He) is a resource.
game_description:
A supercooled chemical extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from smaller mineral formations after inspection with an Analysis Visor.

Extracted from deposits formed in the hostile conditions of gas giants.
source_info: It can be found on planets orbiting purple stars, specifically on gas giants.
release_history: *Worlds Part II - added as a resource.

title: Cursed Dust
summary: Cursed Dust is a resource and one of the Localised Earth Elements.
game_description:
A powdery desert soil, slick with the gland expressions of a colossal sandworm. Historically, some have regarded this dust as the divine parent of such worms. It smells curiously sweet.

Cursed Dust gathers in the terrain deposits of planets blighted by titan worm activity.
source_info: * Obtained as a mission reward from the Outlaw station.
release_history:
* Update 3.70 - Expedition 4: Emergence - Added as an Expedition 4 exclusive resource.
* Outlaws - Added as Pirate Bounty Master reward.
additional_info:
* Available as a planetary Resource Deposit in Expedition 4.
* Used to achieve a milestone in Expedition 4: Emergence.
* Returns as a Resource Deposit in Expedition 13: Adrift.

title: Cyto-Phosphate
summary: Cyto-Phosphate (Cy) is a resource and one of the earth elements.
game_description:
A blue-green organic compound produced during the metabolic cycle of deep-sea plantlife. Rich in soluble energy, cyto-phosphates are crucial in many submarine technologies.

The Mining Laser will harvest cyto-phosphate compounds from underwater flora.
release_history:
* Abyss - Added as a resource.
* Visions - Hidden changes: The information panel has an additional icon indicating its purpose.

title: Deuterium
summary:
Deuterium (D) is a resource and one of the earth elements.

Blue Deuterium Rich Plants gives a short-term boost to the player's jetpack when interacted with. This can help the player travel greater distances using the "jetpack + melee" combo.
game_description:
A stable hydrogen isotope used heavily in both small-scale fusion reactors and neutron-scattering shield technology.

Deuterium very rarely occurs naturally. Most of the galaxy's supply comes from the processing of Di-hydrogen and Tritium in Refiners.
source_info:
Deuterium can be obtained in a variety of ways:
* purchased from terminals or NPCs
* refining process
* dismantling Deuterium-based technology, such as medium or large refiner.
release_history:
* NEXT - Added as a resource.
* Visions - Hidden changes: The information panel has an additional icon indicating its purpose.
* ExoMech - Added as an ingredient for Exocraft Hazard Protection upgrades such as Neutron Shielding.
* Adrift - Can now be refined from Di-hydrogen and Silicate Powder.
additional_info:
The Deuterium-rich plants mentioned above originally produced deuterium when harvested, but this was patched out soon after the initial NEXT release.

Because of this, Deuterium has to be obtained using other means.

title: Di-hydrogen
summary: Di-hydrogen (H) is a  resource and one of the earth elements. It is a main ingredient required to craft fuel for both starships and frigates.
game_description:
A stable, crystalline form of hydrogen remarkable both for its extreme energy density and its stability at atmospheric pressures.

Common to all worlds, Di-hydrogen is found in the form of large blue crystals. It is a key component of Starship Launch Fuel.
source_info:
thumb|Harvesting Di-hydrogen crystals
*Can be found in blue crystal minerals located on nearly every planet. The larger minerals require an Advanced Mining Laser.
*As a secondary element in some minerals.
*Galactic Trade Terminals in pirate controlled systems.
release_history:
* NEXT - Added as a resource.
* Visions - Hidden changes: The information panel has an additional icon indicating its purpose.
* Outlaws - Added to trade terminals in pirate controlled systems.
* Waypoint - Added as a secondary element in some minerals.
* Fractal - Duplication exploit was nerfed.
additional_info:
* Blue crystals used to be a source of Chrysonite before the NEXT update.
* Prior to the Fractal update, you could also gain Di-hydrogen by crafting Di-hydrogen Jelly, then refining it back to Di-hydrogen. This method yielded 10 Di-hydrogen per cycle.

title: Dioxite
summary: Dioxite (CO2) is a localised earth elements.
game_description: Local mineral extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from common minerals after inspection with an frozen environment.
source_info:
* As a secondary element in some minerals or in Resource Deposits or Hotspots on planets with Frozen biomes.
*Found in Hotspots on Mega Exotic planets located in blue stellar systems.
* Available from some
release_history:
* NEXT - Added as a resource.
* Visions - Hidden changes: The information panel has an additional icon indicating its purpose.
additional_info: * Due to it's periodic symbol being CO2, Dioxite may be implied to be some form of carbon dioxide. This is supported by the fact that Dioxite is only naturally found on cold planets and carbon dioxide solidifies into dry ice in extreme cold temperatures of at least −78.5 °C (−109.3 °F). Incidentally, some cold planets are cold enough in No Man's Sky to reach that temperature.

title: Dirt
summary: Dirt is a 1st tier tradeable.
game_description:
Several tonnes of dirt.

Leftover dirt from mining operations. Residual metals can be extracted by specialists in manufacturing economies with the time and equipment to sift through it.
source_info: Dirt can be purchased from Galactic Trade Terminals in all Mining Economy star systems.
use_info: Dirt can be sold for a profit in any upgrading agricultural buildings in their Settlements.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a trade commodity.
* NEXT - Stack size in Exosuit general inventory raised from 1 to 5.
* Waypoint - Type changed, formerly "Tradable Minerals".

title: Emeril
summary: Emeril (Em) is a green stars).
game_description:
A chromatic metal, generated by fusion in the heart of a star. 

Emeril is found on planets orbiting green stars, and can be placed in a Refiner to create purified Chromatic Metal for use in the manufacture of advanced technologies.
source_info:
It can be found on planets orbiting green stars, where it can be mined with the Terrain Manipulator attachment for the Multi-tool. 

It can also be collected by feeding the fauna on certain planets. After a short period of time, they may dig some up or generate the element by various bodily functions.
release_history:
* Release - One of the original elements.
* Pathfinder - Some types now require an Advanced Mining Laser for harvesting.
* NEXT - Can now be refined.
* Synthesis - Chromatic Expansion recipe changed.
* Waypoint Value changed, previously was 348.0.
additional_info:
The game has two Emeril resources, one from pre-NEXT and one post-NEXT. Pre-NEXT Emeril has the name "TRADEABLE6" in the game files, while post-NEXT Emeril has the name "UI_GREEN2".

They feature different descriptions and are treated as different elements, just with the same name.

title: Emeril Drive
summary:
Emeril Drive is a green coloured star systems.

The Emeril Drive is a direct upgrade to the Cadmium Drive in that it allows travel to Red stars without needing to also have a Cadmium Drive installed.
game_description:
Hyperdrive shield matrix is upgraded, preventing temporal anomalies when attempting to reach rare-class green stellar bodies.

User is advised to access Hyperdrive systems via the Galactic Map.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from Iteration: Hyperion on Space Anomaly for 120
release_history:
* NEXT - Added as a technology.
* Visions - Icon changed.
* Beyond - Blueprint changed, Technology Module was renamed to Wiring Loom.
additional_info:
* Operates automatically when installed and needs no fuel or recharging.
* Gives a bonus to hyperdrive range if the upgrade module is installed adjacent to the ship's hyperdrive or other drive modules.

title: Emeril Sunstar
summary: Emeril Sunstar is a fish that can be caught as an item by the player.
source_info: Obtained via fishing.
release_history: *Aquarius - Added as a fish.

title: Enriched Carbon
summary: Enriched Carbon is a tradeable that can also be used to craft certain products.
game_description:
A refined product, taking ordinary carbon and boosting it with radioactive energy.

Crafted from Radon and Condensed Carbon.
source_info: *Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a trade commodity.
* NEXT - Blueprint changed, formerly used Radon and Carbon.
* Beyond - Decreased refining time, was 90.
* Prisms - Added Synthesis Laboratory as a blueprint source.

title: Faecium
summary: Faecium (Fa) is a resource and one of the Harvested Agricultural Substance flora elements.
game_description:
A foul-smelling compound that can be harvested from the Gutrot Flower, or less desirably from the faecal matter of some species.

Creatures can be fed to encourage the formation and deposition of faecium crystals.
source_info:
thumb|right|Collecting Faecium/Coprite in the wild
*This resource can be obtained by feeding creatures on Farmer, Faecium can also be grown as a product of the Gutrot Flower, yielding a base product of 25 with a harvest time of 4 hours.
*It can be found on some planets as a by-product of some carbon-based plants much like some gases.
*Sometimes it can be found in resource deposits on marsh planets.
*It can also be found as junk in some damaged machinery.
release_history:
*Foundation - Added as a resource.
*Atlas Rises - Value changed, previously it was worth 6.9
additional_info: Base harvest amount for Faecium in a bio-dome is 25.

title: Ferrite Dust
summary: Ferrite Dust (Fe) is a resource and one of the metal elements. It is obtainable on the surface of planets, from various rocks.
game_description:
An abundant mineral element, found in rock formations and other areas of geological interest. Easily extracted using a Mining Laser.

Typically requires processing in a Refiner before use in construction or technology manufacture.
source_info:
* As a primary element in most minerals.
* From any
release_history:
*NEXT - Added as a resource. Any Iron in the player's inventory was converted to this resource.
*Visions - Hidden changes: The information panel has an additional icon indicating its purpose.
*Worlds Part II - Added a new source.
additional_info: * It is possible to also collect ferrite dust by using a weapon has a high power capability normally used for mining asteroids, the player can alternatively mine large source of ferrite dust and other basic secondary raw materials (Di-hydrogen, oxygen, sodium, etc.) on a planet surface by flying low and strafing it with a sufficiently powerful starship weapon. Note the starship weapon is incapable of 'mining' big rocks which require the Advanced Mining Laser.  Due to the larger damage capacity of starship weaponry, it is capable of quickly stripping and mining both organic and inorganic material much quicker as compared with using mining laser. In a special case, the Sentinel interceptors perform even better due to their capability to hover in place.
progression_info:
The following progression is used for Ferrite refinement via a Portable Refiner:
* Rusted Metal
* Ferrite Dust
* Pure Ferrite
* Magnetised Ferrite

title: Frigate Fuel (100 Tonnes)
summary: Frigate Fuel (100 Tonnes) is a consumable product which is used as fuel for Frigates. They can be sold for 40,000
game_description:
A large barrel of frigate fuel.

This viscous gel is highly toxic to the touch. A refined fuel, it powers the interstellar engines of large trading ships.
source_info: The blueprint is a reward given during the Freighter Command mission.
release_history:
* NEXT 1.52.1 - Fixed an issue where players would not receive the blueprint, if they finished the Freighter Command mission in multiplayer.
* NEXT 1.58 - Icon and value changed, previously it was worth 100,000
additional_info:
*Frigate Fuel (50 Tonnes)
*Frigate Fuel (200 Tonnes)

title: Frigate Fuel (200 Tonnes)
summary: Frigate Fuel (200 Tonnes) is a consumable product which is used as fuel for Frigates. They can be sold for 80,000
game_description:
A huge barrel of frigate fuel.

This viscous gel is highly toxic to the touch. A refined fuel, it powers the interstellar engines of large trading ships.
source_info: The blueprint is a reward given during the Freighter Command mission.
release_history:
* NEXT 1.52.1 - Fixed an issue where players would not receive the blueprint, if they finished the Freighter Command mission in multiplayer.
* NEXT 1.58 - Icon and value changed, previously it was worth 200,000
additional_info:
*Frigate Fuel (50 Tonnes)
*Frigate Fuel (100 Tonnes)

title: Frigate Fuel (50 Tonnes)
summary: Frigate Fuel (50 Tonnes) is a consumable product which is used as fuel for Frigates. They can be sold for 20,000
game_description:
A small barrel of frigate fuel.

This viscous gel is highly toxic to the touch. A refined fuel, it powers the interstellar engines of large trading ships.
source_info: The blueprint is a reward given during the Freighter Command mission.
release_history:
* NEXT 1.52.1 - Fixed an issue where players would not receive the blueprint, if they finished the Freighter Command mission in multiplayer.
* NEXT 1.58 - Value changed, previously it was worth 50,000
additional_info:
*Frigate Fuel (100 Tonnes)
*Frigate Fuel (200 Tonnes)

title: Frost Crystal
summary: Frost Crystal (Fc) is a resource and one of the Harvested Agricultural Substance flora elements.
game_description: A beautiful blue crystal, this organic compound possesses both great hardiness and a shimmering translucence. It is harvested from the leaves of frozen conditions to thrive in the wild, but can be farmed in all environments with the aid of a Hydroponics Tray.
source_info:
thumb|Wild plant ([[Frostwort) containing Frost Crystals]]
This element can be harvested from wild plants, but requires the use of Farmer, Frost Crystals can also be grown as a product of the Frostwort plant, providing a base yield of 50 with a harvest time of approximately 60 minutes.
release_history:
* Foundation - Added as a resource.
* Atlas Rises - Renamed from Coryzagen (Co) to Frost Crystal. Value changed, previously it was worth 158.1
additional_info: * The base yield for Frost Crystal in a bio-dome is 50.

title: Fungal Mould
summary:
Fungal Mould (Ml) is a resource and one of the Harvested Agricultural Substance flora elements.

The British spelling of this phrase is used in the wiki.
game_description: An oddly-glowing substance, harvested from the gills of toxic climate to thrive in the wild, but can be farmed in all environments with the aid of a Hydroponics Tray.
source_info:
thumb|right|Collecting Fungal Mould in the wild
As described in the Summary, this element can be obtained from specific reddish-brown mushrooms on toxic Farmer, Fungal Mould can also be grown as a product of the Fungal Cluster plant, with a harvest time of 4 hours yielding 50 Fungal Mould.
release_history:
*Foundation - Added as a resource.
*Atlas Rises - Renamed from Temerium (Te) to Fungal Mould. Value changed, previously it was worth 178.8
additional_info: *Fungal Mould can be used to make Fibrous Stew without needing any other ingredients. After cooking the mould to create Non-Toxic Mushrooms, placing the product back into the Nutrient Processor will create Fibrous Stew.

title: Furnace Tank
summary: Furnace Tank is a power technology installed in Biofuel Reactors to power them.
game_description:
High-temperature burn unit, designed to consume a wide range of biological material. Insert materials to initiate burn.

When active, drives an internal turbine to generate power.

title: Fusion Accelerant
summary: Fusion Accelerant is a tradeable that is used for crafting.
game_description:
An advanced fuel source, made from a perfect blend of high potential energy organic materials.

Crafted from Organic Catalyst and Nitrogen Salt.
source_info: *Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250
release_history: * Frigate Fuel and NEXT 1.58 - Icon and value changed, previously it was worth 2,000,000.0

title: Gamma Root
summary: Gamma Root (Gr) is a resource and one of the Harvested Agricultural Substance flora elements.
game_description: A strange substance that seems to slowly shift the air around it. It is found in the roots of the radiation to thrive in the wild, but can be farmed in all environments with the aid of a Hydroponics Tray.
source_info:
thumb|right|Collecting Gamma Root in the wild
This element can be harvested from wild plants, but requires the use of Farmer, it can also be grown as a product of the Gamma Weed plant, yielding 50 with a harvest time of 4 hours.
release_history:
* Foundation - Added as a resource.
* Atlas Rises - Renamed from Candensium (Cn) to Gamma Root. Value changed, previously it was worth 171.9

title: Geode (cave)
summary: Geode is a valuable mineral deposits. It can be analysed to acquire Materials.
game_description:
An unusually vibrant and potentially valuable lump of rock.

Select in the Inventory (
source_info:
* Mining cave minerals (9-13%)
* Practising lore language with NPCs (10%)
* Companions destroying rocks (4%)
* Suspicious Packet (Goods) (1.6%)
release_history:
* Beyond - Added as a curiosity.
* Origins - Can no longer drop TetraCobalt.
