additional_info: Geodes are worth 3,280

title: Glowing Mineral
summary: Glowing Mineral is a curiosity and it is worth 3,280
game_description:
Though its surface is dirtied and dull, polishing this rock reveals a deep inner glow, a glitter beneath a subtly iridescent surface.

Select the inventory (Tab) and crack open with (E).
source_info: One piece each can be harvested from Floating Crystals and from underground Buried Mineral Formations.
use_info:
After analyzing, Glowing Mineral can be converted into one of the following high-value mineral item:
*
release_history: * Origins - Added as a curiosity.

title: Gold
summary: Gold (Au) is a resource and one of the exotic elements.
game_description:
Highly valuable interstellar trading mineral, typically mined from asteroids. Occasionally found in underground planetary deposits.

Universally prized for its beauty and versatility.
source_info:
thumb|Gold found in the wild as 'Metal Fingers'
(NEXT) * As a primary (very rare) or secondary element in some Exotic planets. * Can be extracted from Deep-Level Mineral Deposits on exotic planets. * Acquired as loot dropped by pirates. * Can be found in Metal 'Fingers'. * Can be received from Gold Nuggets after they are analysed. * Also available from some
release_history:
* Release - Added as a resource.
* NEXT - It can now be refined as well as mined, but it cannot be found as crystals anymore. Icon changed. Value changed, previously it was worth 220.0

title: Hexite
summary: Hexite (X) is a resource and one of the special elements.
game_description: An odourless, mineral-rich substance with a hexagonal crystalline structure, harvested from the faecal matter of a creature.
source_info:
Hexite can be acquired in a variety of ways:
*During the Starbirth mission, a set amount of Hexite is awarded at a nearby (marked) crashed freighter, for use in creating the Nexus missions (3.5%).
*Can be obtained at a Multi-Tool Decommissioning Terminal at the Space Anomaly when the player chooses to scrap an Atlantidean Multi-Tool for Void Motes.
release_history:
* NEXT 1.59 - Added as a resource. It has the same icon as Hex Core and Star Seed.
* Visions - Hidden changes: Added as a possible reward for killing fauna on (some) exotic planets.
additional_info: * It was possible to get 12-18 pieces of Hexite as a reward for picking up one Faecium Crystal during the Community Research (week 2) mission.

title: Hot Ice
summary: Hot Ice is a tradeable that is used for crafting.
game_description:
A paradoxical material, made less mysterious by its relative ease of manufacture.

Crafted from Enriched Carbon and Nitrogen Salt.
source_info: *Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a product.
* NEXT - Blueprint changed, formerly used Enriched Carbon and Ammonium Salt, value was 400,000. Hot Ice can no longer be purchased from Galactic trade terminals and NPCs.
* Prisms - Added Synthesis Laboratory as a blueprint source.

title: Hydrothermal Fuel Cell
summary: Hydrothermal Fuel Cell is a  Nautilon's Humboldt Drive.
game_description:
A high thermal energy fuel, contained within a standardised fuel cell. Used to fuel the Humboldt Drive that powers the Nautilon submarine.

Created with a mix of organic compounds (Carbon and cyto-phosphates) and localised mineral salts.
source_info: *Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250
release_history:
* Abyss - Added as a product.
* Prisms - Added Synthesis Laboratory as a blueprint source.
additional_info:
* One Hydrothermal Fuel Cell will fully recharge the Humboldt Drive.
* All the required resources can be collected underwater, eliminating the need to resurface.

title: Indium
summary: Indium (In) is a resource.
game_description:
A chromatic metal, generated by fusion in the heart of a star. Such stellar material ends up forming deposits in the crust of local planets.

Indium is found on planets orbiting blue stars, and can be placed in a Refiner to create purified Chromatic Metal for use in the manufacture of advanced technologies.
source_info: It can be found on planets orbiting blue stars. It's easy to spot because of its specific blue color.
release_history:
*NEXT - added as a resource, using the Cymatygen icon
*Synthesis - Indium duplication made less efficient: Refining x1 Indium + x1 Chromatic Metal yields x2 Indium, reduced from x4.
*Waypoint - Value changed, previously was 464.0.
*Worlds Part II - Added new uses.

title: Indium Drive
summary: Indium Drive is a blue coloured Emeril or Cadmium Drive installed.
game_description:
Upgrades the hyperdrive's computational matrix, preventing temporal anomalies when attempting to reach rare-class blue stellar bodies.

User is advised to access Hyperdrive systems via the Galactic Map.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from Iteration: Hyperion on Space Anomaly for 200
release_history:
* NEXT - Added as a technology.
* Visions - Icon changed.
* Beyond - Blueprint changed, Technology Module was renamed to Wiring Loom.
* Crossplay - Description changed.
additional_info:
* Operates automatically when installed and needs no fuel or recharging.
* Gives a bonus to hyperdrive range if the upgrade module is installed adjacent to the ship's hyperdrive or other drive modules.

title: Ionised Cobalt
summary:
Ionised Cobalt (Co+) is a resource and one of the earth elements.

The British spelling of this word is used in the wiki.
game_description:
A highly energised form of Advanced Ion Batteries, a conveniently portable source of energy for the Exosuit.  

In widespread use as a key component in the creation of advanced technologies and structures.
source_info: * Available from some
release_history:
* NEXT - Added as a resource. It uses the same icon as Chrysonite, which was removed.
* Visions - Hidden changes: The information panel has an additional icon indicating its purpose.
* ExoMech - Became used as an ingredient for Exocraft Hazard Protection upgrades
* Waypoint -Value changed, previously was 401.0.
additional_info:
*13 Ionised Cobalt are required to charge a Portal Glyph. It is actually less efficient than using standard Cobalt, as 20 Cobalt are used instead and the ratio of Cobalt : Ionised Cobalt is 2:1.
* The description refers to Advanced Ion Batteries, although they were removed from the game in Origins.

title: Kelp Sac
summary: Kelp Sac (Ke) is a resource and one of the Harvested Agricultural Substance flora elements.
game_description:
A rubbery, luminescent sac harvested from underwater Candle Kelp plants.

Agricultural science has not yet tamed the Candle Kelp. As such, these sacs cannot be farmed.
source_info:
It can be harvested from Candle Kelp that can be found underwater, but it is advisable to get into interaction range of the plants, as they can replenish the exosuit's oxygen supply.

On the Galactic Map it is indicated with Water if the star system has a body of water. This information is not indicated on planetary scans, however the water on the surface is visible to the naked eye from space.
release_history:
* Foundation - Added as a resource.
* Atlas Rises - Renamed from Rigogen (Ri) to Kelp Sac.
* Visions - Hidden changes: The information panel has an additional icon indicating its purpose.

title: Liquid Sun
summary: Liquid Sun is a resource and one of the special elements.
game_description:
Conventional planetary metal, superheated and then held in a stabilised plasmatic form.

Extracted from metallic terrain deposits using a Solar Ray. Enormously energetic.
source_info: Can be mined from metallic terrain deposits with a Solar Ray.
release_history:
* Living Ship - Added as a resource. 
* Expedition 7: Leviathan - Additional uses introduced.

title: Lithium
summary: Lithium (Li) is a resource.
game_description:
Local metallic extract, typically found in large deposits or harvested from common mineral formations after inspection with an Analysis Visor.

Typically found on ocean planets.
source_info: It can be found in planetary deposits on ocean planets.
release_history: *Worlds Part II - added as a resource.

title: Living Slime
summary: Living Slime (Jn) is a resource and one of the junk special elements.
game_description:
A heavy, oozing slime. It is moving gently, as if it has a heartbeat of its own.

Nutrient source: unknown.
source_info:
Living Slime can be acquired in several ways:
* Purchased and sold at Galactic Trade Terminals and NPCs for a profit.
* Found in alien-infested Derelict Freighters.
* Sometimes dropped when killing fauna on
use_info: Through multiple steps of refining, Residual Goop can be converted to Viscous Fluids, to Living Slime, to Runaway Mould and then to Nanite Cluster.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a resource. It has the same, but a different colored icon as Residual Goop and Viscous Fluids.
* NEXT - Game description changed.
additional_info: Junk type resources have the same symbol (Jn) rather than their own.

title: Magnetised Ferrite
summary:
Magnetised Ferrite (Fe++) is a resource and one of the metal elements.

The British spelling of this word is used in the wiki.
game_description:
Highly processed metal, requiring several stages of processing in a Refiner.

Used in the creation of advanced structures and technologies. Avoid ingestion.
source_info:
* From resource cans dropped by defeated Geodes after cracking them open. Geodes have two rewards for magnetised ferrite:
** 60-80 Fe++, 5.2%
** 80-120 Fe++, 2.6%
* Also available from some
release_history:
* NEXT - Added as a resource.
* Visions - Hidden changes: The information panel has an additional icon indicating its purpose.
additional_info: * Magnetised Ferrite is used to open some quest related Hidden underground Pods by Crashed Freighters.
progression_info:
The following progression is used for Ferrite refinement via a Portable Refiner:
* Rusted Metal
* Ferrite Dust
* Pure Ferrite
* Magnetised Ferrite

title: Marrow Bulb
summary: Marrow Bulb (BU) is a resource and one of the Harvested Agricultural Substance flora elements.
game_description:
A glowing organic bulb, harvested from the Cave Marrow plant found growing underground.

The Cave Marrow has proved resistant to domestication, and no farmable cultivars are known to exist. As such, marrow bulbs must be harvested by hand in the wild.
source_info: It can be harvested from Cave Marrows that can be found in caves.
release_history:
* NEXT 1.65 - Hidden changes: Mordite (x1) + Marrow Bulb (x1) cannot be used to further refine Marrow Bulb (x4).
* Visions - Hidden changes: The information panel has an additional icon indicating its purpose.

title: Methane
summary: Methane (CH4) is a resource and one of the Compressed Atmospheric Gas earth elements.
game_description:
An atmospheric gas found in hostile conditions of gas giants.

Methane is readily harvested from equipment deployed on gas worlds.
source_info: *From Atmosphere Harvesters built on gas planets or the Stellar Extractor Room.
release_history: *Worlds Part II - Added as a resource.

title: Mordite
summary: Mordite (Mo) is a resource and one of the earth elements.
game_description:
Despite much study, little is known about this haunting, crystalline compound.

It is released from the cadavers of dying creatures, but can also be specifically cultivated and harvested from the Mordite Root plant.
source_info: * It can be recovered from killing Marsh planets.
release_history:
*Foundation - Added as a resource.
*Beyond 2.09.1 - Fixed an issue that caused animals not to drop mordite when killed.
*Aquarius - Added fishing bait bonuses.
additional_info: Mordite should not be confused with the mineral Notmordite, as they are two distinct items.

title: Nanite Cluster
summary: Nanite Cluster (∞) is a resource and one of the special elements. It is also a secondary currency (
game_description:
A dense miasma of Nanites, undulating in its potentiality. These clusters are stable, but unrestricted nanite foam can produce undesirable runaway reactions in the presence of organic matter.

Used in the construction of advanced technologies. Highly valuable to specialist traders.
source_info:
Nanite Cluster can be acquired by:
* Searching abandoned buildings on planets.
* Uploading Discoveries
* Discovering all creatures on a planet and claiming the rewarded nanites.
* Feeding certain animals, which will lead you to a buried object that yields them.
* Searching missions.
* Can be found in storage containers while exploring Crashed Freighters.
* Selling Upgrade Modules to Technology Merchants.
* From certain Space Encounters.
* Through multiple steps of refining, Residual Goop can be converted to Viscous Fluids, to Living Slime, to Runaway Mould and then to Nanite Cluster.
* Payment during certain NPC missions.
* Consuming the item Chewy Wires from your inventory.
use_info:
thumb|right|Blueprint Trader at a Gek Station
* Purchase blueprints from Blueprint Traders and Upgrade Modules from Technology Merchants.
* Upgrade starships and multi-tools to higher class
* Payment to Travellers for information including the location of Traveller Graves.
* Purchase additional Companion Pets slots
* Purchase additional squadron slots aboard your Freighter
* Purchase colour options for your Freighter
release_history:
* Pathfinder - Introduced as a resource, which can be used as a currency.
* NEXT - Value changed, previously it was worth 137.5

title: NipNip Buds
summary: NipNip Buds is a curiosity that can be harvested from the NipNip plant.
game_description: A pungent bud harvested from the NipNip plant, often used to produce Gek Nip.
source_info:
thumb|Purchase from a landed ship
The primary source is harvesting.

*Can be purchased in outlaw systems.
*Can be occasionally bought from Nexus missions.
*Can occasionally be purchased on planets from black market traders for nanites.
*Can occasionally be purchased on planets from landed ships.
*It is a possible reward from frigate expeditions.
release_history:
* Visions 1.76 - Fixed an issue where the Farmer would teach the wrong NipNip recipe.
* Desolation - can be found on Derelict Freighters.
* Outlaws - can be purchased in outlaw systems, price increased.
additional_info: * Haz-Mat Gauntlet required to harvest.

title: Nitrogen
summary: Nitrogen (N) is a resource and one of the Compressed Atmospheric Gas earth elements.
game_description:
A reactive atmospheric gas found wherever there is organic life.

Nitrogen is readily harvested from the atmospheres of Toxic and Lush planets.
source_info:
*As a secondary element in some flora.
*From Atmosphere Harvesters built on planets with Lush and Toxic biomes.
*Using Gas Extractor at a Nitrogen Concentrated Gas Cloud on Toxic or Lush biomes.
*It can be found at Resource Depots.
*From Stellar Extractor Room while being in solar systems with Red/Orange stars.
release_history:
* NEXT 1.57 - Hidden changes: NPCs no longer sell Compressed Atmospheric Gas type resources.
* Visions - Hidden changes: The information panel has an additional icon indicating its purpose.
* Beyond - Added Concentrated Gas Cloud as a source.
* Worlds Part II - Added new sources.

title: Nitrogen Salt
summary: Nitrogen Salt is a tradeable that can also be used to craft certain products.
game_description:
A refined product, this is a powerful organic fertiliser in an easily distributed form.

Crafted from Nitrogen and Condensed Carbon.
source_info: *Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250
release_history:
* NEXT - Added as a trade item.
* ExoMech - time for processing changed, was 30
* Prisms - Added Synthesis Laboratory as a blueprint source.

title: Organic Catalyst
summary: Organic Catalyst is a tradeable.
game_description:
A catalytic material used in the creation of many organic fertilisers.

Crafted from Thermic Condensate and Enriched Carbon.
source_info: *Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a trade commodity.
* NEXT - Can no longer be purchased from Galactic trade terminals and NPCs.
* Prisms - Added Synthesis Laboratory as a blueprint source.

title: Oxygen
summary: Oxygen (O<sub>2</sub>) is a resource and one of the fuel elements.
game_description:
Integral to the atmospheric filtering technology at the heart of the life support system.

Exosuit material processing allows oxygen to be harvested directly from appropriate planetary flora.

Other plantlife may be scanned with the Analysis Visor to reveal alternative oxygen supplies.
source_info:
* Can be harvested from red plants in the wild. (These red plants are what used to be Thamium9)
* Can be found as a secondary element in some flora.
* Can be found as a primary element in Underground Toxic Hazard.
* Can always be bought from any
release_history:
* NEXT - Added as a resource.
* Visions - Hidden changes: The information panel has an additional icon indicating its purpose.
* Beyond - Added Concentrated Gas Cloud as a source.
* Waypoint - Icon changed, only available for purchase on "Goods Availability->Abundant" setting.
additional_info:
* Other than not being a power source, Oxygen has largely replaced Thamium9 in game requirements.
* Oxygen rich plants can be found in at least two kind of types. In larger groups or separate. Same as with Sodium rich plants.

title: Oxygen Harvester
summary: Oxygen Harvester is a base building product for extracting Oxygen from the air.
game_description:
An autonomous atmosphere extractor, this device can be left to collect and purify oxygen from the air. User must monitor fuel levels to ensure continued operation.

The resulting gas is compressed and processed, ready for use in all standard life support systems.

thumb|Oxygen Harvester in a base
release_history:
* NEXT - Added as product.
* Origins - Blueprint changed, previously required Oxygen Capsule
additional_info:
* A fully charged device will harvest a maximum of 250 units over a time period of roughly 12 minutes.
* The blueprint is acquired from the Base Computer Archives mission.
*Despite the fact that constructing the Oxygen Harvester looks, sounds, and gives a portable base part impression, the Oxygen Harvester is not considered portable and can only be built within the normal base limits, with a "zone of control"  (+/- 50u?) where no other oxygen extractors may be built in its immediate area.  Current limit is six (6) per site but may be more.  Further experimentation is needed.

title: Oxygen Recycler
summary: Oxygen Recycler is a technology used to augment Life Support's base capacity.
game_description: Increases the base capacity of the Life Support system, allowing the user to go longer between charges.
source_info: The blueprint is known from the start of the game.
release_history: * NEXT - Added as a technology.
additional_info:
*Upgrade bonuses trigger if Oxygen Recycler is adjacent to Life Support or Life Support Upgrades, increasing its bonus above the listed value.
**Oxygen Recycler does not count toward the three-upgrade limit; however, only one Oxygen Recycler can be installed at a time.

title: Oxygen Rerouter
summary:
Oxygen Rerouter is a technology that allows the player to use their Life Support system as an emergency oxygen supply, if their other oxygen sources have been depleted.

It needs to be installed in an exosuit inventory slot for it to take effect.
game_description:
Upgrades the Aeration Membrane of the Exosuit to harvest oxygen from the Life Support system in the event of a breathing emergency, allowing the user to resurface and seek conventional fuel supplies.

Note: Long-term conversion of life support energy to breathable gas is not recommended, and may result in life no longer being supported.
source_info: The blueprint can be acquired from a Technology Merchant for 240
release_history:
* Abyss - Added as a technology.
* Origins - Blueprint changed, previously used Salt Refractor.
additional_info: Oxygen Rerouter does not trigger adjacency bonuses with the other life support upgrades and is considered a lone blueprint upgrade. Even though this upgrade simply states that it upgrades the Aeration Membrane, this is not the case for direct purposes.

title: Paraffinium
summary: Paraffinium (Pf) is a localised earth elements.
game_description: Local mineral extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from common materials after inspection with an tropical environment.
source_info:
* As a secondary element in some minerals or in Resource Deposits on planets with Lush biomes.
* From Hotspot on planets with Lush biomes.
* Also available from some
release_history:
* NEXT - Added as a resource.
* Visions - Hidden changes: The information panel has an additional icon indicating its purpose.

title: Phosphorus
summary: Phosphorus (P) is a localised earth elements.
game_description: Local mineral extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from common minerals after inspection with an scorched environment.
source_info:
* As a secondary element in some red stellar systems.
* Also available from some
release_history:
* NEXT - Added as a resource.
* Visions - Hidden changes: The information panel has an additional icon indicating its purpose.
* ExoMech - Added as an ingredient for Exocraft Hazard Protection upgrades such as Megawatt Heater

title: Platinum
summary:
Platinum (Pt) is a resource and one of the exotic elements.

Platinum is the most expensive single element.
game_description:
Extremely valuable interstellar trading mineral, typically mined from asteroids. Occasionally found in underground planetary deposits.

Universally prized for its hardiness and versatility.
source_info:
* Can be bought from some Galactic Trade Terminals or Ship Traders.
* Can be mined from crystalline/amorphous asteroids.
* As a secondary element in some minerals in caves.
* By destroying freighter cargo
release_history:
thumb|Platinum in blue vegetation
(Atlas Rises) * Release - Added as a resource. * NEXT - It can now be refined as well as mined, but it cannot be harvested from blue flowers anymore. Icon changed. Value changed, previously it was worth 55.0

title: Polished Stone
summary: Polished Stone is a curiosity that can be harvested from ruined structures found on ruined worlds.
game_description:
The powdery remains of a highly polished mineral surface. It glitters as it catches the light, like fiery glands of sand. 

Acquired by applying the Mining Laser to the structural remnants located on ruined worlds.
source_info:
thumb|An example of a Ruined Structure.
Can be harvested from Ruined Structures found on ruined worlds using a Mining Beam.  Small amounts can also be gained from defeating Vigilant Stone guardians.
use_info:
Upgrades

Polished Stone is used to upgrade buildings in your settlements.
release_history: *Worlds Part II - Added as a curiosity.
additional_info:
The Ruined planets come in the following names:
* LUSH RUINED		-		Abandoned Paradise,   Overgrown,   Overgrown Relic,   The Reliquary
* BARREN RUINED		-		Abandoned,   Ruined,   Ruined Dustbowl,   Abandoned Desert
*SCORCHED RUINED		-		Ruined,   Scorched Relic,   Lost to Fire,   Abandoned Crucible
*FROZEN RUINED		-		Abandoned,   Icy Ruin  , Frozen Relic
*TOXIC RUINED			-		Abandoned,   Bleached Ruin,   Decaying Ruin
*RADIOACTIVE RUINED		-		Ruined,   Claimed By Decay,   Mutating Relic
*DEAD RUINED		-		Abandoned

title: Polychromatic Zirconium
summary: Polychromatic Zirconium is a 4th tier tradeable.
game_description:
A sack full of polychromatic zirconium crystals.

These crystals produce lenses of dazzling colour and near-indestructible hardness. Highly valuable in manufacturing economies.
source_info: Polychromatic Zirconium can be purchased from Galactic Trade Terminals in all high-wealth Mining Economy star systems. It is also obtainable in some, but not all, medium-wealth systems with this Economy.
use_info:
Polychromatic Zirconium can be sold for a profit in any Manufacturing Economy star system.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a trade commodity.
* NEXT - Stack size in Exosuit general inventory raised from 1 to 5.
* Waypoint - Type changed, formerly "Tradable Minerals".

title: Pugneum
summary: Pugneum (Pg) is a resource and one of the special elements.
game_description: This oily, unsettling liquid leaks from the circuitry of Nanites. It hums in a sinister fashion upon contact with organic matter.
source_info:
Drops from destroyed Sentinels; the received amount depends on what type of sentinel is destroyed, see more information here.

Also available from some
release_history:
* overseer could examine a sample (50 units) from a downed sentinel drone and extract the plans for every building part the drone has ever scanned.
* NEXT - Value changed, previously it was worth 137.5
additional_info: * Pugneum can be sold at the damaged components in crashed starships and damaged multi-tools. (Example: Scorched Plating)

title: Pure Ferrite
summary: Pure Ferrite (Fe+) is a resource and one of the metal elements.
game_description:
Processed metal, free of dust and pebbles. Used to construct a wide variety of structures and technologies.

Typically purified from Ferrite dust using a Refiner, but can occasionally be found in large deposits. Collection may require an Advanced Mining Laser.
source_info:
*As a primary or secondary element in some minerals. These minerals usually require Advanced Mining Laser to harvest.
* Also available from some
release_history:
* NEXT - Added as a resource.
* Visions - Hidden changes: The information panel has an additional icon indicating its purpose.
* Waypoint - Icon changed.
progression_info:
The following progression is used for Ferrite refinement via a Portable Refiner:
* Rusted Metal
* Ferrite Dust
* Pure Ferrite
* Magnetised Ferrite

title: Pyrite
summary: Pyrite (Py) is a localised earth elements. It is used as fuel for the starship's Pulse Engine.
game_description:
Local mineral extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from common materials after inspection with an Analysis Visor.

Typically found on planets with a desert environment.
source_info:
* As a secondary element in some minerals or in Resource Deposits or Hotspots on planets with Barren biomes.
* Also available from some
release_history:
*NEXT - Added as a resource.
*Visions - Hidden changes: The information panel has additional icons indicating its purpose.
*Worlds Part II - Added a new source.

title: Quartzite
summary: Quartzite (Qu) is a resource.
game_description:
A chromatic mineral, generated by fusion in the heart of a star.
Such stellar material ends up forming deposits in the crust of local planets.

Quartzite is found on planets orbiting purple stars, and can be placed in a Refiner to create purified Chromatic Metal for use in the manufacture of advanced technologies.
source_info: It can be found on planets orbiting purple stars, where it can be mined with the Terrain Manipulator attachment for the Multi-tool.
release_history: *Worlds Part II - added as a resource.

title: Radon
summary: Radon (Rn) is a resource and one of the Compressed Atmospheric Gas earth elements.
game_description:
A colourless, odourless gas with a relatively short half-life.

Found in both Radioactive and Frozen atmospheres, this gas is produced by the decay of other high-energy elements.
source_info:
*As a secondary element in some Irradiated or Frozen biomes.
*Using Gas Extractor at a Radon Concentrated Gas Cloud.
*It can be found at Resource Depots.
release_history:
* NEXT 1.57 - Hidden changes: NPCs no longer sell Compressed Atmospheric Gas type resources.
* Visions - Hidden changes: The information panel has an additional icon indicating its purpose.
* Beyond - Added Concentrated Gas Cloud as a source.

title: Re-latticed Arc Crystal
summary: Re-latticed Arc Crystal is a 5th tier tradeable.
game_description:
A neatly wrapped parcel of re-latticed arc crystals.

Extremely rare mineral formations, arc crystals are in high demand in manufacturing economies, where their hardness and conductivity is vital to several industrial processes. They also make alluring (if dangerous) jewellery.
source_info:
It can be purchased from Galactic Trade Terminals in all high-wealth Mining Economy star systems.

It can also be obtained via the completion of missions.
use_info:
* It can be sold for a profit in any Manufacturing Economy star system.
* 3 can be traded to a space station Merchants Guild envoy to increase your rank.
* It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a trade commodity.
* NEXT - Stack size in Exosuit general inventory raised from 1 to 5.
* Waypoint - Type changed, formerly "Tradable Minerals".

title: Residual Goop
summary: Residual Goop (Jn) is a resource and one of the junk special elements.
game_description:
A pulsating, foul smelling goop that builds up in poorly-maintained machinery.

Skin contact is not advised.
source_info:
thumb|Obtaining Residual Goop from a Forsaken Terminal
Every Abandoned Building has a terminal and interacting with it allows the player to either discard the Residual Goop or move it to the exosuit inventory. After that the terminal  can be used. Each terminal can contain up to 200 Residual Goop.

Residual Goop can be purchased from some Galactic Trade Terminals and pilot NPCs.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a resource. It has the same, but a different colored icon as Living Slime and Viscous Fluids.
* NEXT - Game description changed.
* Frontiers - Can now be refined from Cursed Dust.
additional_info: * Junk type resources have the same symbol (Jn) rather than their own.

title: Runaway Mould
summary:
Runaway Mould (Jn) is a resource and one of the junk special elements.

The British spelling of the word is used in the wiki.
game_description:
An out of control mould growth that builds up in poorly-maintained machinery.

Likely to be several different species of mould, merged together into one super-colony.
source_info:
thumb| Runaway Mould in the marketplace (Atlas Rises)
* This item can be received as a gift from the Guild representatives in space stations.
* Runaway Mould can be purchased and sold at Galactic Trade Terminals and NPCs for a profit.
* This item can be received from encrypted missions at the Nexus.
* This item can also be obtained from Curious Deposits on some planets, appearing as a sphere that rolls when mined.
use_info: Through multiple steps of refining, Residual Goop can be converted to Viscous Fluids, to Living Slime, to Runaway Mould and then to Nanite Cluster.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a resource.
* Interceptor - Can be refined from Atlantideum and Pugneum
additional_info:
* Junk type resources have the same symbol (Jn) rather than their own.
*It has the same icon as Containment Failure

title: Rusted Metal
summary: Rusted Metal (Jn) is a resource and one of the junk special elements.
game_description:
Handfuls of corroded metal, distorted by years of exposure to the harsh environment.

Handle with care.
source_info:
thumb| Obtaining Rusted Metal from a Damaged Container
* Upon opening a Damaged Container, a GUI will pop up with an option to either discard or keep some Rusted Metal. Each container can contain between 50 and 100 Rusted Metal. Once the Rusted Metal is either discarded or moved to your inventory, the Damaged Container will open and you can receive a reward.
* Rusted Metal can be purchased from some Dead Worlds.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a resource.
* NEXT - Game description changed.
* Visions - Added as a Resource Deposit.
additional_info: * Junk type resources have the same symbol (Jn) rather than their own.
progression_info:
The following progression is used for Ferrite refinement via a Portable Refiner:
* Rusted Metal
* Ferrite Dust
* Pure Ferrite
* Magnetised Ferrite

title: Salt
summary: Salt (NaCl) is a resource and one of the earth elements.
game_description:
A naturally occuring salt, found in abundance in underwater minerals.

Can be processed in a Refiner to create Chlorine. This refined form is used in the manufacture of advanced products and technologies.
source_info:
* As a secondary element in some minerals.
* Primary element in most underwater minerals.
* In Resource Deposits.
* Also available from some
release_history:
*NEXT - Added as a resource.
*Visions - Hidden changes: The information panel has an additional icon indicating its purpose.
*Waypoint - Value changed, previously was 299.0.
*Aquarius - Added fishing bait bonuses.
additional_info: Salt is a very valuable mineral and mining from Deep-Level Mineral Deposits can result in a highly lucrative farm.

title: Semiconductor
summary: Semiconductor is a tradeable that is used for crafting.
game_description:
An advanced material useful in many electronic devices, with its own in-built temperature regulator.

Crafted from Thermic Condensate and Nitrogen Salt.
source_info: *Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a trade commodity.
* NEXT - Blueprint changed, formerly used Thermic Condensate and Ammonium Salt.
* Beyond - value changed from 320,000 to 400,000

title: Silicate Powder
summary: Silicate Powder (Si) is a resource and one of the metal elements.
game_description:
An abundant mineral element, found within the geological strata of all rocky worlds. Easily extracted using a Terrain Manipulator. Create a tunnel anywhere to begin extraction.

Process in a Refiner to create Glass.
source_info: * It can be mined from soil using the Terrain Manipulator.
release_history: * Beyond - Added as a resource.

title: Silver
summary: Silver (Ag) is a resource and one of the exotic elements. It is one of the main ingredients for crafting freighter related base building products.
game_description:
Valuable interstellar trading mineral, typically mined from asteroids. Occasionally found in underground planetary deposits.

Prized by people in all systems for its lustre and shine.
source_info:
* Can be mined from asteroids.
* Can be found in Resource Deposits.
* As a secondary element in some minerals in caves.
* Also available from some
release_history:
* NEXT - Added as a resource.
* Visions - Hidden changes: The information panel has an additional icon indicating its purpose.
* Beyond - Hidden changes: Value has changed from 101.0

title: Sodium
summary: Sodium (Na) is a resource and one of the catalyst elements.
game_description:
A powerful catalyst, useful for charging defensive technologies such as shields or hazard protection.

Exosuit material handling technology allows automatic harvesting from appropriate sodium-rich flora.

A vital ingredient in the creation of many advanced devices, products and components.
source_info:
* From yellow flowers visible on the Scanner.
* As a secondary element in some minerals.
* As a primary element in Underground Toxic Hazard.
* In Resource Deposits.
* Can always be bought from any
release_history:
* Visions 1.77 - Hidden changes: Refining added to the "Used for" list.
* Waypoint - Only available for purchase on "Goods Availability->Abundant" setting.
additional_info:
* A Portable Refiner can be used to change Sodium into Sodium Nitrate
* Note that a unit of Sodium Nitrate is six times as good at charging technologies and requires only two sodium to produce. This makes it both more storage and energy efficient.
* The flower models from which Sodium is harvested used to be sources of Zinc before the NEXT update.
* Sodium-rich plants can be found by themselves or, rarely, in large groups. Same as with Oxygen-rich plants.

title: Sodium Nitrate
summary: Sodium Nitrate (Na+) is a resource and one of the catalyst elements.
game_description:
An advanced catalyst, useful for charging defensive technologies such as shields or hazard protection.

Created in a Refiner, or occasionally found in crystalline form on a planet's surface.

Offers a substantially improved energy-per-gram ratio over regular Sodium.
source_info:
* In yellow crystal minerals located on nearly every planet. These minerals require an Advanced Mining Laser and are visible on the Scanner.
* Also available from some
release_history:
* NEXT - Added as a resource.
* Visions - Hidden changes: The information panel has an additional icon indicating its purpose.
additional_info:
* Sodium Nitrate is 6x better at charging technologies than Sodium. If you acquire it by refining 2 Sodium, using Nitrate gives you an effective 3x boost in the time you can stay exposed
* 10 Sodium Nitrate is used when repairing a drop pod

title: Solanium
summary: Solanium (So) is a resource and one of the Harvested Agricultural Substance flora elements.
game_description:
thumb|Solar Vine plant, the source of Solanium
A powerful chemical that has resisted attempts at synthesis. It can be harvested from the bark of the hot climate to thrive in the wild, but can be farmed in all environments with the aid of a Hydroponics Tray.
source_info: This element can be harvested from wild plants, but requires the use of Farmer, Solanium can be grown as a product of the Solar Vine plant, providing a base yield of 50 with a harvest time of 16 hours. It requires the use of Haz-Mat Gauntlet to safely harvest.
release_history:
*Foundation - Added as a resource.
*Atlas Rises - Renamed from Fervidium (Fr) to Solanium.
*NEXT - It can now be refined. It can be harvested or found as a secondary element in flora.
*Visions - Hidden changes: The information panel has an additional icon indicating its purpose.
*Waypoint - The Optical Drill no longer increases the harvest yield.
*Aquarius - Added fishing bait bonuses.
additional_info: * Base harvest amount for Solanium in a bio-dome is 50.

title: Somnal Dust
summary: Somnal Dust is a resource and one of the special elements.
game_description:
Grey, dead, sparkling with life and colour, singing as it shimmers. This impossibly fine dust is the accumulated decay of time and memories.

Collected from the fine layers it forms around hotspots in the loop. Of great value to Specialist Polo as they research the loop.
source_info:
Can be found on Derelict Freighters and are used in Expedition 7: Leviathan.

Can be gathered on any derelict freighter via using Q to bash-mine the onboard pustules.
release_history: * Expedition 7: Leviathan - Introduced as a resource.

title: Star Bulb
summary: Star Bulb (Sb) is a resource and one of the Harvested Agricultural Substance flora elements.
game_description: A beautiful gemstone, this prized product is the engorged, luminescent berry of the lush conditions to thrive in the wild but can be farmed in all environments with the aid of a Hydroponic Tray.
source_info:
thumb|Star Bramble in the wild (NEXT)
This element can be harvested from wild plants, but requires the use of Farmer, Star Bulbs can also be grown as a product of Star Bramble with a harvest time of approximately 4 hours and yielding 25 Star Bulbs.
release_history:
*Atlas Rises - Added as a resource.
*NEXT - It can now be refined. It can be harvested or found as a secondary element in flora.
*Visions - Hidden changes: The information panel has an additional icon indicating its purpose.
*Waypoint - The Optical Drill no longer increases the harvest yield.
*Aquarius - Added fishing bait bonuses.
additional_info: It has the same symbol as the chemical element

title: Starship Launch Fuel
summary:
Starship Launch Fuel is a consumable product which is used to provide fuel for a starship's Launch Thrusters. It provides 100% Launch Thruster fuel when consumed.

It can be crafted or refined, with Di-hydrogen being the primary ingredient in both cases. Once obtained, a single stack can hold up to 40 units in a Storage Container or Freighter inventory and 20 units in other inventories.
game_description:
Highly reactive solid-state fuel, required to fuel Starship Launch Thrusters.

Created from crystallized Di-hydrogen, found in blue deposits on all worlds.
release_history: *NEXT - Added as a product.

title: Sulphurine
summary: Sulphurine (Su) is a resource and one of the Compressed Atmospheric Gas earth elements.
game_description:
A pungent atmospheric gas. High concentrations are extremely hazardous to organic life.

With the aid of specialised machinery, can be extracted from the atmospheres of
source_info: *As a secondary element in some Star System
release_history:
* NEXT 1.57 - Hidden changes: NPCs no longer sell Compressed Atmospheric Gas type resources.
* Visions - Hidden changes: The information panel has an additional icon indicating its purpose.
* Beyond - Added Concentrated Gas Cloud as a source.

title: Superconductor
summary: Superconductor is a tradeable that is used for crafting.
game_description:
An advanced conductive material, the superconductor further enriches the field-warping power of the Semiconductor.

Crafted from Enriched Carbon and Semiconductors.
source_info: *Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250
release_history:
* Atlas Rises -  Added as a trade commodity.
* NEXT - Can no longer be purchased from Galactic trade terminals and NPCs.
* Prisms - Added Synthesis Laboratory as a blueprint source.

title: Supply Depot
summary:
Supply Depot is a base building product that can be used to store extracted Compressed Atmospheric Gas and resources from Deep-Level Mineral Deposits. 

* Supply Depots are connected to Mineral Extractors or Gas Extractors using Supply Pipes.
* Resources are automatically transferred to the Supply Depot/s in timed batches. The player must interact with the Depot to transfer resources into their inventory.
* Each Supply Depot adds 1000 units of storage capacity (the extractors themselves store 250). Connecting more Supply Depots (to the Extractor or a connected Supply Depot) increases the total storage capacity.
game_description:
Automated storage unit. Connect to a Supply Grid using Pipelines.

Automatically stores the output of various Mineral and Gas Extractors, allowing for increased capacity and more efficient siting. Can be located a long distances
source_info: The blueprint can be obtained from the Construction Research Station aboard the Space Anomaly for 10 Salvaged Data.
release_history: * NEXT - Added as a base building product.

title: Tainted Metal
summary: Tainted Metal (Un) is a resource found in Derelict Freighters. It is used to trade for suspicious items and cosmetics with the Scrap Dealer, or for converting into Nanites via refining.
source_info:
*Resource found in Derelict Freighter space encounter.
*Received from Scrap Dealer and Guild Envoy in exchange for Crew Manifest and Captain's Log.
release_history: * Origins - Added as a resource.
additional_info: The Scrap Dealer on the space station sells contraband in exchange for Tainted Metal.

title: Thermic Condensate
summary: Thermic Condensate is a tradeable that can also be used to craft certain products.
game_description:
A refined product, holding the energy potential of heated atmospheric gas in a stable state until required.

Crafted from Sulphurine and Condensed Carbon.
source_info: *Blueprint can be found in Manufacturing Facilities and Operations Centres, or purchased from Synthesis Laboratory for 250
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a trade commodity.
* NEXT - Blueprint changed, formerly used Sulphurine and Carbon. Now it can also be crafted.
* Beyond - Decreased refining time, was 90.
* Prisms - Added Synthesis Laboratory as a blueprint source.
additional_info: Thermic Condensate can no longer be purchased from Galactic trade terminals and NPCs.

title: Tritium
summary: Tritium (H3) is a resource and one of the exotic elements. It is used for crafting freighter related base building products, frigate fuel and fuel for your starship's Pulse Engine.
game_description:
Radioactive isotope commonly used to fuel the fusion reactor at the heart of starship Pulse Engines.

Abundant in interstellar asteroid fields, Tritium can be mined from asteroids using starship weaponry.
source_info:
Tritium can be acquired in a variety of ways:

* Extracted from some asteroids, tritium rich asteroids can be detected with the starship scanner.
* In its crystallized form as a Tritium Hypercluster. (Hover over them with your mouse and press E to "Analyze".) (97%)
* As a secondary element in some cave minerals (14%)
* Some
release_history:
* NEXT - Added as a resource.
* Visions - Hidden changes: The information panel has an additional icon indicating its purpose.

title: Underwater Oxygen Upgrade
summary: Underwater Oxygen Upgrades, contained within Underwater Protection Modules, are procedurally generated upgrades granting supplementary air while underwater.
game_description:
A supreme upgrade for the Aeration Membrane.

An almost total rework of the Aeration Membrane, this upgrade module brings unparalled improvements to the Oxygen Tank.

Charge equipment with Oxygen or Life Support Gel.
release_history:
* NEXT - Added to the game as an upgrade.
* Origins - Repair/Dismantle formulas changed, formerly used Oxygen Capsule instead of Life Support Gel.
additional_info:
* Underwater Protection Modules can be recharged, allowing the player to stay underwater as long as they have Oxygen and Life Support Gel to spare. As Oxygen can be refined from Candle Kelp plants found underwater, the player may be able to stay underwater indefinitely.
*Underwater Protection Modules do not transfer any adjacency bonuses to any of the other hazard protection upgrades in existence; not even the aforementioned Aeration Membrane gives the same benefit despite the added breathing efficiency. As such, Underwater Protection Modules only provide these bonuses to each other.

title: Unrefined Pyrite Grease
summary: Unrefined Pyrite Grease is a 2nd tier tradeable.
game_description:
Large jars full of pyrite grease.

A fat solution with a high mineral content. This grease is highly valued by manufacturing economies, where it's used to keep large machinery oiled and glistening.
source_info: Unrefined Pyrite Grease can be purchased from Galactic Trade Terminals in all medium-wealth and high-wealth Mining Economy star systems. It is also obtainable in some, but not all, low-wealth systems with this Economy, this item can also be found by destroying cargo bays in a space frigate or freighates.
use_info:
Unrefined Pyrite Grease can be sold for a profit in any Manufacturing Economy star system.

It is not usable by the player in Crafting or Base building.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a trade commodity.
* NEXT - Stack size in Exosuit general inventory raised from 1 to 5.
* Waypoint - Type changed, formerly "Tradable Minerals".

title: Uranium
summary: Uranium (U) is a localised earth elements. It is used as fuel for the starship's Launch Thruster.
game_description: Local mineral extract, typically found in large deposits or extracted from common minerals after inspection with an radioactive environment.
source_info:
* In Mineral deposits on Irradiated biomes.
* Can be found in Metal 'Fingers'.
* Also available from some
release_history:
*NEXT - Added as a resource.
*Visions - Hidden changes: The information panel has an additional icon indicating its purpose.
*Echoes - Purchase made very expensive.
*Worlds Part II - Added new sources.

title: Viscous Fluids
summary: Viscous Fluids (Jn) is a resource and one of the junk special elements.
game_description:
An unnaturally thick liquid of dubious colour. Its origins are impossible to fathom.

Appears to have some mild magnetic properties.
source_info:
Viscous Fluids can be purchased and sold at Galactic Trade Terminals and NPCs for a profit.
Viscous Fluid frequently appears as a removed item to repair Damaged Machinery.
use_info: Through multiple steps of refining, Residual Goop can be converted to Viscous Fluids, to Living Slime, to Runaway Mould and then to Nanite Cluster.
release_history:
* Atlas Rises - Added as a resource. It has the same, but a different colored icon as Living Slime and Residual Goop.
* NEXT - Game description changed.
additional_info: * Junk type resources have the same symbol (Jn) rather than their own.

title: Void Mote
summary: Void Motes are a Voltaic Staff crafting components, and Rebuilt Exosuit Modules from Autophage Synthesis Terminals and Harmonic Interfaces.
game_description:
A purified drop of Atlantideum, refined to its very essence. This precious material is acquired by earning favour with and assisting the Autophage.

Visit the Autophage Synthesis Terminal found at all Autophage Camps to exchange Void Motes for unique customisation options.
source_info:
* By completing Autophage missions (200-600 Void Motes).
* By scrapping an Atlas Multi-Tool at the Multi-Tool Decommissioning Terminal (100-5400 Void Motes).
* Void Motes can occasionally be found in wheelbarrows around Harmonic Camps.
release_history: * Echoes - Added as a resource.

infobox.name: Void Mote
infobox.desc: Used as currency with the Autophage.
